004package kut;
005
006import java.util.function.Function;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008
009/** Package of a result. */
010public class Rs<T> {
011  final String error;
012  final T value;
013
014  Rs (String error, T value) {
015    this.error = error;
016    this.value = value;
017  }
018
019  /**
020   * Creates a Rs of type 'ok'.
021   * @param <T> Value type.
022   * @param value The value.
023   * @return Rs
024   */
025  public static <T> Rs<T> ok (T value) {
026    return new Rs<>(null, value);
027  }
028
029  /**
030   * Creates a Rs of type 'error'.
031   * @param <T> Value type.
032   * @param msg The error message.
033   * @return Rs
034   */
035  public static <T> Rs<T> error (String msg) {
036    return new Rs<>(msg, null);
037  }
038
039  /**
040   * Returns 'true' if 'this' is of type 'error'
041   * @return 'true' if 'this' is of type 'error'
042   */
043  public boolean isError () {
044    return error != null;
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Returns the error message.
049   * @return The error message.
050   * @throws IllegalStateException y 'this' is of type 'ok'.
051   */
052  public String getError () {
053    if (error == null)
054      throw new IllegalStateException("Rs is 'ok'");
055    return error;
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Returns the result value.
060   * @return The result value.
061   * @throws IllegalStateException y 'this' is of type 'error'.
062   */
063  public T getValue () {
064    if (error != null)
065      throw new IllegalStateException("Rs is 'error'");
066    return value;
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Returns the result of apply 'f' to the value of 'this'.
071   * If this is of type 'error', returns also a Rs of type 'error'.
072   * @param <U> Rs returned type.
073   * @param f Function to apply.
074   * @return Rs.
075   */
076  public <U> Rs<U> bind (Function<T, Rs<U>> f) {
077    return this.error != null
078      ? Rs.error(this.error)
079      : f.apply(value)
080    ;
081  }
082
083  @Override
084  public String toString () {
085    return error != null
086      ? "Rs[Error: " + error + "]"
087      : "Rs[Ok: " + value.toString() + "]"
088    ;
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Returns Rs 'JSONized' in 'js'.
093   * @param <T> Type of Rs element.
094   * @param js Rs 'JSONized'.
095   * @param eFromJs Function to restore the element of the Rs 'JSONized' in 'js'.
096   * @return Rs 'JSONized" in 'js'.
097   */
098  public static <T> Rs<T> fromJs (String js, Function<String, T> eFromJs) {
099    ArrayList<String> a = Js.ra(js);
100    if (a.size() != 2) {
101      js = js.length() <= 50 ? js : js.substring(47) + "...";
102      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
103      "  \n'" + js + "' is not a valid Rs JSONization." +
104      "  \n Rs JSONization type are \"[\"error\",null]\" or \"[\"\",JS-element]\""
105      );
106    }
107    return Js.rb(a.get(1))
108      ? ok(eFromJs.apply(a.get(0)))
109      : error(Js.rs(a.get(0)))
110    ;
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Returns JSON representation of 'Rs' ("["error", false]" or "[JS-element2, true]").
115   * @param <T> Type of 'trs' element.
116   * @param rs Rs.
117   * @param eToJs Function to 'JSONize' the element of 'tp'.
118   * @return JSON representation of 'rs'.
119   */
120  public static <T> String toJs (Rs<T> rs, Function<T, String> eToJs) {
121    return rs.isError()
122      ? Js.w(Arr.mk(Js.w(rs.error), Js.w(false)))
123      : Js.w(Arr.mk(eToJs.apply(rs.value), Js.w(true)))
124    ;
125  }
126}
